intro: Plectronia travancorica, commonly known as the Travancore plectronia, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
